intro: Paullinia venusta, commonly known as the golden star soursop, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon basin. It is a member of the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and elliptical, leathery leaves. The plant produces a large, spiky fruit that is edible and has a sweet, aromatic flavor. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and traditional uses.
